definitions.definition: To draw (an object, especially a sharp or angular one), along (something) while exerting pressure .
examples: She scraped the wooden plate with her fingernails.
That car often scrapes the shallowest of humps because of its low ground clearance.

definitions.definition: To remove (something) by drawing an object along in this manner.
examples: Scrape the chewing gum off with a knife.

definitions.definition: To injure or damage by rubbing across a surface .
examples: She tripped on a rock and scraped her knee.

definitions.definition: To barely manage to achieve or attain .
examples: I scraped a pass in the exam.

definitions.definition: To collect or gather , especially without regard to the quality of what is chosen.
examples: Just use whatever you can scrape together.

definitions.definition: To extract data by automated means from a format not intended to be machine-readable , such as a screenshot or a formatted web page .
examples: They didn't provide an API, so I simply scraped their website.

definitions.definition: To occupy oneself with getting laboriously .
examples: He scraped and saved until he became rich.

definitions.definition: To play awkwardly and inharmoniously on a violin or similar instrument .
examples: Some people covered their ears when he started to scrape his violin.

definitions.definition: To draw back the right foot along the ground or floor when making a bow .
To express disapprobation of (a play , etc.) or to silence (a speaker ) by drawing the feet back and forth upon the floor; usually with down .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To draw (an object, especially a sharp or angular one), along (something) while exerting pressure .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To remove (something) by drawing an object along in this manner.
( transitive ) To injure or damage by rubbing across a surface .
( transitive ) To barely manage to achieve or attain .
( transitive ) To collect or gather , especially without regard to the quality of what is chosen.
( computing , transitive ) To extract data by automated means from a format not intended to be machine-readable , such as a screenshot or a formatted web page .
( intransitive ) To occupy oneself with getting laboriously .
( ambitransitive ) To play awkwardly and inharmoniously on a violin or similar instrument .
( intransitive ) To draw back the right foot along the ground or floor when making a bow .
To express disapprobation of (a play , etc.) or to silence (a speaker ) by drawing the feet back and forth upon the floor; usually with down .
